Package station

Class Station

  • java.lang.Object
    • station.Station
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlusStation
    public class Station
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing station. It is a central part of the system, where slots are stored. A terminal is available for the user to interact with the system. In addition, it holds a station balance, to calculate the station statistics depending on input parameters ( a time window). Finally, an array is used to save the times the whole station is offline.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Station​(int id_num, boolean online, GPS coord, int number_of_slots)
      Initializes station without terminal through the use of SlotCreator to assure correct filling of the slots.
      Station​(int id_num, boolean online, GPS coord, int number_of_slots, double empty, double regular)
      Initializes station without terminal with custom percentages for maximum rate of empty slots and regular bikes.
      Station​(int id_num, boolean online, GPS coord, Terminal t, int number_of_slots)
      Initializes station with terminal through the use of SlotCreator to assure correct filling of the slots.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Station

        public Station​(int id_num,
               boolean online,
               GPS coord,
               int number_of_slots)
        Initializes station without terminal through the use of SlotCreator to assure correct filling of the slots.
        Parameters:
        id_num - ID of the station. Is an integer
        online - Boolean variable representing if the station is online or not
        coord - GPS coordinates of the station. It is a GPS type
        number_of_slots - Number of slots of this station. Is an integer.

      • Station

        public Station​(int id_num,
               boolean online,
               GPS coord,
               int number_of_slots,
               double empty,
               double regular)
        Initializes station without terminal with custom percentages for maximum rate of empty slots and regular bikes. Same use as both others constructors
        Parameters:
        id_num - ID of the station. Is an integer
        online - Boolean variable representing if the station is online or not
        coord - GPS coordinates of the station. It is a GPS type
        number_of_slots - Number of slots of this station. Is an integer.
        empty - Maximum percentage of empty slots in the station
        regular - Maximum percentage of regular bikes in the station

      • Station

        public Station​(int id_num,
               boolean online,
               GPS coord,
               Terminal t,
               int number_of_slots)
        Initializes station with terminal through the use of SlotCreator to assure correct filling of the slots. Only to be used in testing. The correct version used in the system initialization does not include the terminal because it needs a reference station for correct use.
        Parameters:
        id_num - ID of the station. Is an integer
        online - Boolean variable representing if the station is online or not
        coord - GPS coordinates of the station. It is a GPS type
        t - Terminal to be attributed to the station
        number_of_slots - Number of slots of this station. Is an integer.

    • Method Detail

      • hasDesiredBike

        public boolean hasDesiredBike​(java.lang.Class<?> bikeType)
        Method for checking if station has the bike type desired by the user
        Parameters:
        bikeType - Class object with the desired bike type
        Returns:
        Boolean that is true if it has the desired bike type, false if it hasn't

      • hasFreeSlot

        public boolean hasFreeSlot()
        Method for checking if the station possesses free slots
        Returns:
        Boolean that is true if it has a free slot, false if it has not

      • getBikeByID

        public Bike getBikeByID​(int id)
        Method for getting a Bike object from this station based on its ID. Should be used only to aid VelibSystem methods
        Parameters:
        id - ID number of the bike being searched
        Returns:
        Bike object with desired id, if it is in this station

      • chargeUser

        public void chargeUser​(User usr,
                       double money,
                       long time_credit)
        Charges user with a certain amount of money and discounts a certain time credit.
        Parameters:
        usr - User object to be charged
        money - Double value containing the money value being charged
        time_credit - Time credit being discounted from cumulated value

      • setStationOnline

        public void setStationOnline​(java.time.LocalDateTime time)
                      throws IrregularOperationException
        Used by the CLI to set the station online
        Parameters:
        time - Time when station is set online. Used for statistics
        Throws:
        IrregularOperationException - Throws this exception when someone tries to put online a station already online

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IrregularOperationException - Throws this exception when someone tries to put offline a station already offline
